input_text:
Job Title: Medical Doctor

Location: Stockton, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Health Care Provider, Other, Science

Description:
As an Associate level position, we welcome candidates with 1 to 2 years of experience, and management experience is not required.Our client is dedicated to empowering seniors to maintain their independence within the comfort of their own homes and communities. We are deeply committed to providing a comprehensive range of medical services that prioritize the holistic well-being of each participant, focusing not just on symptoms, but on the entire individual. In our nurturing environment, our interdisciplinary team collaborates closely to assess and guide the care of each participant. This collaborative approach lies at the heart of our client's values, fostering a culture of compassion and fulfillment in our mission.As a Primary Care Physician with our client, you will play a pivotal role in conducting thorough assessments and crafting personalized care plans in coordination with our interdisciplinary team. Under the guidance of the Medical Director, you will oversee participant care across various settings, ensuring seamless coordination and leveraging specialized medical expertise when needed. A Doctorate Degree is the minimum education requirement, with a willingness to travel frequently. Our client is committed to fostering a supportive and inclusive workplace where every team member can thrive. We reimburse interview travel expenses and provide relocation assistance for the right candidate. We do not require security clearance or consider visa candidates at this time.Master’s Degree or Doctorate DegreeBoard Certification in Internal Medicine or Family PracticeActive California Physician License without RestrictionsConduct comprehensive assessments and provide primary care to participantsCollaborate with community-based physicians and our interdisciplinary team in discharge planningActively engage in interdisciplinary team meetings to facilitate informed care decisions and ensure round-the-clock care deliveryProvide ongoing care management for participants in nursing homes, including regular visits as required.Participate in rotating night and weekend on-call dutiesCompletion of a residency program accredited by the Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical EducationMaster’s Degree or Doctorate DegreeBoard Certification in Internal Medicine or Family Practice; Board Certification in Geriatrics preferredActive California Physician License without RestrictionsState CDS Certification and DEA RegistrationValid State Driver’s License with a clean DMV record and recent Vehicle InsuranceUtilize your clinical expertise in a dynamic, rapidly expanding environmentFoster a culture of care and support, where every team member is valuedComprehensive medical insurance coverage (Medical, Dental, Vision)Generous personal time off (PTO), holidays, and sick time for a healthy work-life balance401(k) savings plan with matching contributionsOpportunities for career advancement and professional developmentContinuing Medical Education (CME) and Paid Time AwayEquity grants, extending the opportunity to celebrate company successMalpractice Insurance coverage

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Medical Doctor
output_json.summary: Associate level position welcoming candidates with 1 to 2 years of experience.
job_responsibilities: Overseeing participant care across various settings
Completing night and weekend on-call duties
Fostering a culture of care and support
